result.execSummary:
The defendant Amond D Galtney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Amond D Galtney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Amond D Galtney was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Amond D Galtney was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant not to use or possess any dangerous weapon.
If not employed, Def to do 10 hrs of Community Service weekly.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur to each other.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant not to use or possess any weapon.
Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Random searches of home, car and possessions for contraband.
Any outstanding costs to be collected through ES.

miscConds.notes: Court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 2.

superMiscConds.notes: All other conditions are the same as count 2.

- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000.00 per case. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $10,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 11

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Pat Bomhack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
